Name: Grapple
Description:
Grapple is a word game where players combine word roots with prefixes and/or suffixes to make valid words.

There are three decks, for Prefixes, Roots, and Suffixes, each having 50 cards and 2 blanks.  Each player is dealt 2 cards from each deck. 
During their turn, a player: 
- Draws a card from any deck
- Does any of the following, as many times as they can:
--- Lay down a word made from 2-3 cards in the hand
--- Add a card from the hand to a word on the table to make a new valid word which is moved to be in front of them.
--- Take a card from a word on the table, if it leaves a valid word with 2 cards, to make a new word using the stolen card.
- If the player is unable to make any plays during the turn, they discard back down to 6 cards.

The player to empty their hand first wins.

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Clayface Promo Card
Description:
This DC Deck-Building Game Promo Card was included with early orders of DC Deck-Building Game: Dark Nights: Metal ordered directly from Cryptozoic and some retailers.

Villain 
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck, then discard all cards with the highest cost revealed this way. Draw the rest.

Name: Flappy Families
Description:
Flappy Families is a family-friendly card game for 2 - 5 players where players collect sets of native New Zealand birds while trying to avoid the Predators!

Players will have to engage their memory to try and match birds of the same families. As well as flipping cards face up on the board players will be putting their own cards face down onto the board. They will be able to use this information to try and make future matches - unless another player foils their plan!

At the end of the game the player with the best collection of birds, judged by having large families and by collecting birds from the special bonus point families, will be crowned the winner.

The game features 51 unique illustrations of native New Zealand birds, as well as the fearsome predator: the Stoat. The beautiful illustrations have been made by the talented Auckland-based Sam Kim.

—description from the designer

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Bitter Harvest – Enemy At The Gates
Description:
Enemy at the Gates is an expansion for the Heroes of the Bitter Harvest for the Lock 'n Load Tactical series.

It features a fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level, and individual heroics, plus lots of armor and special rules to bring the fight for the city of Stalingrad. From the first drive to cut off the city along the north bank of the Volga to the brutal and close-in street to street and room to room fighting that raged across the city. Fighting in the Dzerzhinsky Tractor Works Factory and on the slopes of Mamayev Kurgan. Fighting in the Red October Factory complex and at Pavlovs House as well as the German attempt to capture the main ferry landings are covered. New equipment is introduced to both sides as the Maxim Machinegun and the ROKS-3 flamethrower are added to the Soviet arsenal. The Germans receive shipments of MG42 Machineguns and the StuH 42 join the battle.
 New Module Specific rules are introduced such as Severe Rubble terrain, Snipers are allowed to reposition to take advantage of the unique Sniper engagements that were so common in Stalingrad. Sewer movement is also introduced as it was such a pervasive means of getting around the bombed-out city.

4 new maps and 1 sheet of counters are included in this expansion

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Umbrella Sky
Description:
Umbrella Sky is a tile-laying, city beautifying game with colorful umbrellas, banners, and light bulbs!

In Umbrella Sky, players compete with each other to decorate their street and get the attention of tourists by hanging beautiful umbrellas, colorful banners, and bright light bulbs! The more attractive the street, the higher the score!

A public art project inspires this game with the same title exhibited in cities worldwide to add color to the gray spaces around us.

- Finalist to The Cardboard Edison Award Design Contest 2022
- Finalist to The ION Awards Design Contest 2022
- Finalist to The Board Game Workshop Design Contest 2021

—description from the designer

Name: Mini Rogue: Coaster Expansion
Description:
Mini Rogue Coaster Expansion is a small expansion with additional quests. At the start of the game you roll a die to determine which quest has been assigned to you (for example "Kill 10 Monsters"). Upon the completion of the quest you gain 4 XP.

This Expansion was initially a Kickstarter Exclusive.

Name: Warzone Eternal
Description:
Warzone Eternal is a fast-playing skirmish miniatures game in which players collect a force representing one of humanity’s five powerful megacorporations—Bauhaus, Capitol, Cybertronic, Imperial, and Mishima—or the hordes of necrobionic warriors of Algeroth, the Dark Legion Apostle of War. Through scenario-driven battles, players will engage in the constant covert, or not so covert, fight for supremacy amongst the megacorporations or the never-ending battle against the darkness to preserve humanity—or destroy it.

Warzone, the classic tabletop miniatures game of skirmishes in the techno-fantasy universe of Mutant Chronicles, returns with Warzone Eternal! A massively popular miniatures game in the 1990s, Warzone captured the imagination of players with its adrenaline-fueled imagery and its quick and engaging ruleset. Res Nova seeks to recapture that spirit with Warzone Eternal and has assembled a crack team to do so.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: AdvenTourist
Description:
In this game, you own a travel agency. Your task will be to manage touristic regions in Hungary.
From season to season, you must upgrade services (like entertainment, gastronomy) and build attractions in your regions, then attract tourists to earn money and victory points.
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

Name: Fröbel Tower
Description:
"Play: Playing is the highest stage of a child’s development." (Friedrich Fröbel)

This Fröbel Tower is a cooperative game for 2-16 players aged four and over. It is also well suited for adult team building.

The game consists of:

    6 beechwood blocks
    1 bracket with metal rod
    1 plate with 8 holes and 16 cords (each 2 metres long)


For the Fröbel Tower, a large outdoor or indoor play area is necessary.

Object of the game
The construction of the Fröbel Tower is possible only by means of joint, coordinated action. The Fröbel Tower can also be built in a competition between different groups.
The group that can build the highest tower wins the game in this version.

Preparation
Form a circle and place the six beechwood blocks in the middle with the groove facing upwards.

Rules
Each player takes one or more cord ends in his or her hand, depending on the number of participants.
The cords were previously passed through the 8 holes in the plate. Now you tighten the cords and try to hook the bracket into the groove of a wooden block, lift it up carefully and place it gently on another wooden block.
It is important that you hold the cord only at the very end. It must not be shortened by reaching forward.

Together you try to stack the wooden blocks on top of each other until the Fröbel Tower is completed. You have won the game as a team if you manage to use all the wooden blocks and the tower does not fall over during the building work.
When you hook in the bracket, this may cause a wooden block to fall over. Therefore, you should decide before the game starts whether this wooden block can be put back in place or whether it is eliminated from the game.

Game variants

    The game is not over until you have dismantled the tower as a team.
    You are not allowed to speak during the game. Naturally, this makes building the tower more difficult because you cannot give each other any instructions.
    You are only allowed to guide the cord with one hand. This also adds another level of difficulty.
    The most difficult way to build the tower is to guide the end of the cord with your "weak" hand. For right-handers it is the left hand, for left-handers the right hand.


—description from the publisher

Name: SUWANGO
Description:
A misterious collector wants to get all the incredible creatures on the planet. She has selected us to complete her collection, taking us to an island of unknown whereabouts where the strangest beings on the planet live.
Became an explorer in a truly beautiful and unique tabletop game experience.

SUWANGO is a highly thematic game where players must fulfill the SUWANGO Code to capture the creatures they have to get to fulfill their secret objective. Beware of the rest of the explorers, they will not hesitate to sabotage your mission to be the first to get the coveted loot.
The first to complete their board will end the game and the one with the most points will win.

Name: Middara: Aboyama, The Rapturasque Resin Kit
Description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Rapturasque. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

—description from publisher

Name: Middara: Taiga, Hedonistic Muse Resin Kit
Description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

—description from the publisher

Description:

Description:
