Name: Middara: Lupercalia 2021 Pack
Description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Just like our Cross Promotion Pack, our Resin Lupercalia Kits from last year are now available in plastic. The Lupercalia 2021 Pack includes a plastic set of all seven of the miniatures we made in Resin from our last Kickstarter. This also includes their Item Cards, Combatant Cards, and Adventurer Cards.

Profane Occultists Made Immortal

“Toxie scrubbed the blood from her hands, noting idly that she had nailed the color when choosing her crimson fingernail polish. In the far corner of the abandoned warehouse, a half dozen corpses, all still bound hand and foot, lay in a heap as testament to her night’s labors. Her final victim lay sprawled on the concrete floor behind her, still breathing shallowly through his broken, twisted mouth. She hadn’t actually been planning to pull out his teeth when she started questioning him, but then Luperci and Tixie had radioed in that they cleared the enemy’s hideout, and that Mena was one of the captives they had freed. Threatening the Faun was one thing; dragging an innocent child into it was something else altogether.

Toxie dried her hands gingerly, then turned around to consider her captive. He was definitely dying; even if someone found him now, there weren’t enough surgeons or drugs on Earth to save him. But Toxie had to meet up with her pack to run down the last of the heathens who had escaped with the Faun, and she didn’t like leaving jobs unfinished.

She hunkered down next to him and saw with satisfaction that his eyes were still open, though only just through the swollen wreckage of his face. She blew him a kiss.

“You get a little mercy now,” she crooned as she gently stroked a blood-free patch of skin on his forehead. “I’m late for an orgy, so I can’t really wait around for you to die. You know how it is. . .” 
She turned to her gear bag and considered her options. She wanted to use her favorite, but, of course, it had to be the messiest of the lot and she had just finished cleaning up. Eh, what the hell, she thought. Grinning, Toxie grabbed the pink handle and turned back to finish the job.

Outside the warehouse, an early morning train rumbled past, just loud enough to mask the roar of a chainsaw.”

This product contains 7 miniatures, Adventurers, Espers, and new Items.

These new Espers spice your game with unknown variety by adding new Espers that can be summoned by both Adventurers

—description from the publisher

Name: Middara: Kickstarter Cross-Promotion Pack
Description:
We promised y'all last year we’d be providing any resin kits we make in plastic. This pack includes all ten of the miniatures we made in Resin from our last Kickstarter. This also includes their Item Cards, Combatant Cards, and Adventurer Cards.


    boxes in images not included


That means that this pack adds new Adventurers, Combatants, Espers, Items, and some alternate art cards for the starting four adventurers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aeon's End: Legacy of Gravehold – Promos
Description:
A 32 card pack of Kickstarter exclusive cards received for backing the Legacy of Gravehold Campaign. Included:


     Talusoid Clod
     Chronophage Coil
     Parasitic Force
     Ilya’s Trulite Force
     Kiel’s Trulite Energy
     Qu’s Call of the Void
     Thraxir’s Nameless Siphon
     Cairna’s Invigorate
     Dezmodia’s Eternal Darkness
     Ohat’s Shower of Coals
     Lucien’s Sun Shard
     Reth’s Fossilized Rose
     Taqren’s Defense Glyphs
     Z’hana’s Scimitar
     Arachnos’s Spellbook

Name: Kernel
Description:
Kernel is a press-your-luck dice game for small and large groups. Players collect as many kernels as possible all while racing to 100 points. Learn in under 5 minutes. Be smart, quick, and lucky to take home the win. The player that collects the most Kernels wins!

About the game:

     Lose or gain kernels depending on your roll.
     Be the first to grab the corn cob squeeze when doubles are rolled to earn bonus kernels!
     Play it safe or risk it all to earn extra kernels.
     Everything you need to play in a convenient canvas storage bag.
     Great game for kids to practice addition and risk management skills.
     Fun for the whole family and large groups!


—description from the publisher

Name: Breaking the Luftwaffe
Description:
Breaking the Luftwaffe is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check Your 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. The book provides three campaigns and 26 scenarios under one cover. The first 9 scenarios follow the beginning of the US 8th Air Force’s escorted strategic bombing campaign over western Germany between October 1943 and January 1944; the next 9 scenarios recreate the intense combat during the “Big Week” air offensive in early 1944; the final 8 scenarios bring together the desperate fighting during Mission 250, the first daylight mission to Berlin. The book also features some of WWII’s top aces including Robert S. Johnson, Gabby Gabreski, “Bud” Anderson, Heinz “Pritzl” Bär, Anton Hackl, and Heinz Knoke. The scenarios can be played individually, linked to form three mini-campaigns, or combined as one grand campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate
Description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering reintroduces the Commander Draft format originally seen in the first Commander Legends and fuses it with the Dungeons & Dragons theme of Adventures in the Forgotten Realms, using the Forgotten Realms city of Baldur's Gate as the setting.

Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate is designed to be drafted. Each player opens a 20-card booster pack, selects two cards from it, and then passes the pack to the player sitting next to them. They then pick two more cards from the pack they've been handed, and so on, going around the table until all cards are picked. This is repeated with a second booster pack, and again with a third, until everyone has picked a total of 60 cards. Players then choose a commander (or a commander/background pair, if the commander has the Choose a Background ability) from among the cards they drafted, add any number of basic lands, and build a 60-card deck matching the color identity of their commander(s). Then everyone shuffles up their decks and battles in a free-for-all! (A larger pod of drafters splits into two groups first.)

The set is sold in draft boosters (individually or in displays of 24), set boosters (individually or in displays of 18), collector boosters (individually or in displays of 12), and bundles, as well as three-pack prerelease kits, which were made available a week in advance of the set's full release. In addition, four 100-card tie-in Commander decks were released alongside the main set.

Name: Get Off My Grass!
Description: A Tile laying and Resource management game for 2 to 4 players of mowing over some tough turf. Get your 2 mowers back to the house  first to win, but which way you take and what you mow over all depends on you!

Name: Sushi Skillz
Description: A small game that came in a "Welcome to the Orient"-themed Battle Bin subscription box. Players gather ingredients to make sushi recipes for points. Game has no box, just a plastic bag.

Name: Pitch Out: Nomads Vs Seeds
Description:
Pitch Out 2 is a box with new teams (Nomads and Seeds) for the Pitch Out system. The two boxes can be played separately (2 players), or combined (3 and 4 players).

It is a disk-flicking game with tactical elements in which players try to take out or isolate the opponent's leader.

The game is played with a bunch of disks (5-8 for the base sets) and five "walls". In turns, players place their pieces and two walls on their side of the field. Then, they start flicking one disk per turn, trying to push the opponent's disks out of the field.

Each disk has a special power, for example the Assassin just needs to touch an opponent's piece to take it out, so players need to play tactically.

The first player to take out the opponent's leader or all their other pieces wins the game.

Name: Origins: Ancient Wonders
Description:
Ancient Wonders is an expansion to Origins: First Builders and consists of two separate modules which can be added to your game separately or together.

Ancient Wonders
This module enables a new type of building that can be added to your city, eight majestic ancient wonders that bring more variability and options to the game.

Trials of the Builders
End-of-round scoring objectives require you to find the right balance between pursuing advancements required by the current round objective versus progressing the personal goals you have set for your civilization already. This module also brings a predetermined length to the game, eliminating all other end game conditions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mosómaci Almája
Description:
The raccoons ran into the city. There, they chat, play at night, and do their best to get their favorite treat, the apple. Housekeepers, on the other hand, don’t really like this night dating; if they can, they confuse the teddy bear.

Make your macid the most skillful! Go ahead and swap the cards to make it harder for the other raccoon!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Bogyó és Babóca Évszakok
Description:
The four different board games based on the Bogyó and Babóca series are primarily for 3-8 year olds, mainly the preschooler age group.

The simplest type of game is card collecting, the third is a classic step-by-step countdown game that aims to get to the polka dot ladybug house, and the fourth, conversational game requires the help of an adult who reads out questions related to the theme of the seasons.

Name: Bogyó és Babóca Úton az oviba
Description:
Who gets to the ovi sooner, where the nanny is waiting for Dongó's kindergarten teacher and Aunt Pettyes Futrinka? It is a long journey through the woods and it hides a lot of games and fun.

Almost all the characters in the fairy tale series are featured in this lovely board game. Swing with a ax lock, pick up peanuts with Squirrel Rego! If you are good at throwing and you are lucky, after a lot of forest adventure you will be the first to go to kindergarten! The easy-to-understand yet exciting game is great fun for little friends of Bogyó és Babóca Tales.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different and counting your RADISHES!
Description:
This is the 'superhard' version of "A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different and counting your beetroots." and "AGAQGCTATDACYTurnips."

Players race to grab creatures, but each creature you grab must have a different head (number of eyes), different body (number of arms), and different number of legs.

You can put vegetables in between creatures, but if you grab more than 5 portions, you have been deemed too greedy and lose the game.

In this 'super-hard' edition, the creatures are wearing things, looking away from the 'camera', contorting in weird positions and doing other things that might will add a few seconds of confusion, even for experienced players!

This game is NOT recommended for anyone who hasn't played the earlier editions.

To make it even more visually confusing, most of the vegetable cards have additional items on them. Monocle, sketchbook, or even stuffed toys of the creatures! (But they aren't creatures, they are only stuffed toys of creatures.)

One deck plays up to 3 players. Combine decks to play with more (2 decks for up to 6, 3 decks for up to 9)

There are 2 versions of AGAQGCTATDACYRadishes (coloured in, and line art) for easy mixing and separation.

Name: Mondriaan
Description:
Mondriaan is a game in which colors and colored areas as well as their number play a very special role.

As simple as monochrome rectangles may be, they can be used in many different ways, which is why totally different game variants await you here.

In one of them, you'll have to keep track of the colors and be quick to react. In the second, on the other hand, it won't hurt if you think a little ahead so that you end up where the most points are.

GAME VARIANT: DICE STUDY

For this variant you need one die and five chips or coins per person. The 12 Mondriaan cards are laid out in the center of the table in a 3x4 grid.

One person rolls a number, while another randomly reveals one of the color cards, if possible at the same time. The two together determine what you need to look for in the cards.

So, if there is a 6 and a red card, you have to look for a card that has six red color squares on it and quickly put one of your chips on it. Whoever succeeds first gets to discard the chip.

Since each combination occurs exactly twice, you can also get rid of two chips per round. If you have no more chips, you win the game.

GAME VARIANT: SPACE COMPOSITION WITH 6 COLORS

For this variant you need two dice and three differently sized game pieces or markers per person, each in one color.

The six color cards are placed face up on the table as a circle. The shuffled Mondriaan cards are distributed evenly to everyone.

Take turns placing one marker on each color card. Never place two markers of the same size on the same card, but place several markers of the same size on the same card.

When both dice are rolled, you take turns performing one of the following actions:
-  place a card from your hand on a color card matching the value of a die (if you roll a 6, you can place a card with six red squares on the red color card)

- place one of the upper Mondriaan cards already on the table on another color card, if the conditions there are right.

- place one of your own point markers on another color card

When a person puts down their last card, you calculate your points:
For the color with the most cards on it you get three points, for the next two and then one.
You then multiply these points by the values of your markers, from small to large with one to three.
Whoever has the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Model War Kingdom
Description:
Long ago, alien beings conquered a world of wild creatures and scattered mystic portals across the land.  In time, they left.  Now, many millennia later, varied animal kingdoms have arisen -- and learned to use the ancient pathways in their fierce competition!

A skirmish game of cute animals fighting for dominance and survival... and cursing the beautiful land with unwelcome guests.

Player Chose two Creatures from 8 each. And take turn to perform from three Actions for each of their creatures in any order; Move, Attack and place Portals. As well as Upgrading, summoning, casting... in and between Turns.

The Ancients portal's


When you go throught the portals you leave fregment of yourselves in doing so. Fragments that others can pick up on. Fragments from your subconscious mind. And when you gather fragments of others subconscious mind is done so by attaching itself to yours and in the process you can not separate that its yours and that of others since you have no control or awareness. And when it builds up over time its surfaces to the conscious mind as an intuition, a habbit, a memory, as in evolution. You gather them and build on them, develop it, learn it. 
It becomes a skill, an ability... a power.

A great Power!

A power that inanimate all other. 
A power that can not be stoped and cant stop.
A power that must be destroyed.

Name: Trekkers
Description:
Identify pictures of landmarks and sights from different nations shown in the cards while going “trekking.”

—description from the rulebook

Name: For What Remains: Terrain and Template Pack Expansion
Description: This expansion adds 9 new double-sided terrain tiles which allow the player to blend scenery from the 3 games (Streets of Ruin, Blood on the Rails, Out of the Basement) together. Also included are 4 transparent ability templates.

Name: X MAS M.T. Motoscafi Esplosivi
Description:
Solitary game on the attacks of the X Flotilla MAS against the Royal Navy bases of Malta and Suda Bay, in Crete.

Parabellum magazine X, Spring 2022

Name: Turtle Bay
Description: Today is the big hatching day: the cute baby turtles in Turtle Bay are finally hatching from their eggs. And of course they want to get into the ocean as fast as possible. But with so much turmoil, the clumsy sea creatures quickly end up on their backs and can no longer move forward without your help. In the beastly good children's game, a lucky hand with the dice is just as important as a little bit of tactical skill.

Name: Stargrave: The Last Prospector
Description:
The second supplement for Stargrave offers a host of new scenarios and rules for gaining political backing as you fight across the ravaged galaxy.

The Dahlgren Belt was once a vast asteroid mining operation that supplied the entire sector with rare metals and various elemental fuels. However, the isolation of the last war caused the corporation to wither, and the various outposts and colonies were eventually left to look after themselves. Some became true collectives, or limited democracies, while others have fallen to the rule of gangsters, warlords, and despots. In all cases, the limited resources of air and organic material has made life difficult.

In this supplement for Stargrave, the crews must travel from asteroid-to-asteroid, and even down to the system's single, barely inhabitable planet, searching for a man who claims to have discovered a ‘big score'. During their journey, players will fight through numerous different environments - including asteroid mines, zero gravity, and even hellish jungle. Captains must curry favour with the various small political factions that hold power in the Belt. Only through a combination of wits, diplomacy, and weapons can players hope to reach the last prospector and gain a share of his claim…

—description from the publisher

Name: Book of Skulls: Slayers of Eragoth
Description:
Heavy Metal meets Fantasy in Book of Skulls: Slayers of Eragoth

A huge dungeon-crawling adventure where two teams battle to save the continent of Eragoth.

For 2-4 players in 2 teams. Teams act as the others’ opponents, whilst one team controls the heroic Slayers, the opposing team will control the Demons they encounter until it is time to switch to their own Slayers.

The objective whilst controlling the Slayers is to clear the overworld and defeat the final boss first, whilst controlling the Demons your aim is to defeat the opposing team’s Slayers.

Replay value and combat is at the heart of Book of Skulls. During your adventure, you will have access to over 150 unique characters, each with their own movesets.

A game of high interactivity as players have no down time as they cross the continent, always engaged and always with high stakes.

Set your overworld using 10 interchangeable modular maps (levels) that each represent a unique region of Eragoth. A different adventure awaits with each game as any number of levels can be selected and placed in any order, allowing you to customise the duration of your game.

Book of Skulls is fully soundtracked with an original Metal soundtrack which perfectly sets the mood for battling the Demons of Eragoth.

—description from the publisher

Name: Illeria
Description:
Illeria is a fantasy wargame, in which players control small parties of former prisoners, who fight for survival on the defunct prison island of Illeria. Illeria plays like a cross between a skirmish-style wargame and 3D-chess.  Battles are fought on two parallel boards: the harsh Illerian desert of the physical world, and the mystical and surreal badlands of the spirit world.  Characters exist in both worlds, and actions in one world often affect the other.  For example, characters can spend actions in one world to boost their counterpart, and killing a character in one world greatly harms them in the other.

Illeria is a miniatures-agnostic game, in which you can play with any models you have.  It can be played as either a one-off game, or as part of an ongoing campaign.

Name: Home Before The Leaves...FALL!
Description:
This game is based on a paradox.  The fact that two armies went to war with modern equipment, and tactics based on experiences of another century. The belief that the bayonet and the massed charge of men and horses was mightier than machine guns and rapid firing field artillery, that stuck in the minds of the Generals and statesmen, even when proved wrong. The beginning of the 1914-1918 saw a "mobile war" of sort, a planned "blitzkrieg" of marching men and railway timetables that broke down. Could it have succeeded?  This game cannot give an answer, only a hint.

Game includes 1 tabloid-size map, 3 pgs. of rules, 88 counters (unmounted), and charts. This appears to be a game taken from Combat magazine. Description verbiage is taken verbatim from the game.

Name: Nexum Galaxy: Beyond
Description:
«…With time and the Atavians’ forced collaboration, they learned to better exploit the Planets by installing powerful Proton Cannons and Orbital Bases to work as shipyard-shuttles. They also discovered the special riches in some Moons, and they established a commercial network by building Enclaves linked to the Stars…»

There are three types of special structures in the expansion: the Proton Cannon, the Commercial Enclave and the Orbital Base. Each player can only build one of them per turn, as long as there are tokens available and during any phase of their turn. They can be captured along planets (or stars in the case of Commercial Enclaves)

Name: Newton: Sun Set Promo
Description:
Essen 2022 preorder link

6 Sun Set action cards, that have more focus on the Voyage action.

The New Edition of Newton already include many promos, but not this one.


This Newton add-on provides 6 new Action cards (+1 rule card). Each player starts with one of these cards (they are assigned through a draft during setup): these are all travel actions, linked to a specific city on the map. Whoever plays such cards gets a very interesting power, but only if have visited the showed city (so providing a mid-term game objective).


Rules :

SETUP: Shuffle the Sun Set cards, then draw a number equal to the player count + 1 and place them face up on the table. Following the reverse turn order, each player chooses 1 card and place it in their hand together with their Starting Action cards. Place the remaining cards back in the box.

GAMEPLAY: The new cards are used normally to perform a Travel action. In addition, if you have already a Travel cube on the indicated University - City - Ancient Land, you will get the indicated bonus effect. If you don't have the cube there, you only perform the main action without the bonus.

(Sun Set cards are considered starting action cards for the objectives.)

Name: Newton: New Horizon
Description:
Newton: New Horizon is a new game board that provides a new technology track. You can find spaces that
give VP in special conditions and objective spaces that give double VP.

In more detail, as long as you have at least one student on a triangular space, you receive 1 VP every time you perform the indicated action. You receive 1 VP if you perform it as a Basic Action and/or as a Special Effect from an action card and/or as an effect from an Invention tile or a Master card. The bonus is always 1 VP even if you have more students on the same space and even if the action's value is more than 1.

Two Objective spaces on the board show a x2 symbol and require 5 Volumes. If you have a Student here at the end of the game, you will receive double the VP provided by that Objective tile (so, if the tile shows a "max. X" limitation, also that limitation is doubled).

Name: Wattignies 1793
Description:
La bataille de Wattignies (AKA Wattignies 1793) covers the battle fought on 24 et 25 Vendémiaire an II (15th and 16th octobre 1793) between the french "armée du Nord" under the command of general Jourdan and an austrian army under the command of the prince of Coburg. It is one of the main victories of the french army during the wars of the french Revolution.

La bataille de Wattignies is the sixth game of the series "les soldats de la République" and is edited by VaeVictis.

The game includes an A2 map and 216 counters and markers.

3 scenarios are provided for this battle : the historical two-day battle, the battle without historical constraints and a shorter scenario covering only the second day.
Families: Series: Les Soldats de la République (Vae Victis)

Name: Tick Tack Bumm Pocket
Description:
As with the other editions of Tick Tack Bumm (aka Pass the bomb), speed is the most important factor in the pocket version. Here, however, no bomb goes from hand to hand, but everyone always plays at the same time! The bomb at Tick Tack Bumm Pocket can be found on some of the cards to be turned on: In this category it is important to find a word as quickly as possible that contains the letter combination you are looking for. Poetry fans have the advantage of looking for a suitable rhyme word. And with the magnifying glass symbol, a word that matches the respective category is required. If you play fast-paced and with brains, you quickly get closer to the goal of first discarding all cards and thus winning the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Barrage: Executive Officer Promo D
Description:
A new executive officer for Barrage, originally distributed at Modena Play 2022.


Franze De Lasse

When you perform a production action and fulfill a Contract with a lower value than the energy produced, move your marker on the Energy Track only by the exceeding value.

During the End of Round Phase, move your marker back on the Energy Track to the lower limit of the current round section (only if vou have reached it). Otherwise, don't move your marker back.

Name: Dark Matter: A Game of Strategy and Survival
Description:
Dark Matter is a competitive sci-fi strategy board game for three to six players. Players will use strategy and diplomacy to earn victory points through expanding your empire with StarBase construction, researching dark matter that will populate in the center of the board through the game, through diplomacy with your rival players, construction and protection of your flagship, and by completing objectives. Offers board and event randomization so that no two games are the same.

—description from the designer

Name: BANKS
Description:
In the year 2511 in a society run through Augmented Reality; omnipotent corporations have replaced each continent. A fast paced, cutting edge game known as BANKS is the neo-gladiator approved sport on Earth, with teams embodying each of their corporate spheres. As players you fight for your sphere's personal freedoms and to gain corporate favor.

In BANKS you face up to five various opponents. With the disks distributed over the light rails, your goal at the end of the game is the product of the number of disks in each captured color. Highest score wins, AMASS!

On your turn, move one of your disks in a straight line over any number of open spaces, possibly banking off edges or corners of the board, (like pool). You may stop at any point after moving at least one space.

If, after banking off at least one edge, your disk lands on a space occupied by any other disk (even one of your own disks), capture that disk by replacement. At the end of the game, your score is the number of disks in each captured color multiplied.

—description from the designer

Name: Pio's Pigeon Post
Description: Help Pio get the postage right. You'll need a little luck and, above all, some good math skills to get the job done. The player who can correctly calculate postage for the most mail wins.
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Happy Little Trees
Description: In Happy Little Trees your goal is to be the first player to discard your personal deck of cards by matching and planting trees according to color and shape.

Name: Cowbell
Description:
Cowbell is meant to be a gentler introduction to many of the contracts played in the more elaborate, traditional card game, Vira. Most of the same contracts remain (presented in a different form) but some contracts have been added (to make the game a little easier for those just starting out) and some have been removed (for the same reason).

Cowbell is as much about risk-taking as it is about trick-taking.

So, be bold: try to ring the Bell of Fame! and never earn the Cow of Shame...
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: The Egyptian Enigma
Description:
Agent Cleo works for the mysterious organisation known as the Ministry of Time... and she’s trapped in Egypt in 1922! This looks like foul play... She’s sent a package through time, desperately hoping it falls into the right hands. Can you save her?

The Egyptian Enigma is an escape room challenge contained entirely in one exciting package. Search through a mysterious series of envelopes, solve the puzzles and outsmart your enemies; all before the timer runs out!

Everything is in the package; documents, clues, secrets and traps that you’ll have to navigate to save the day.
All you’ll need is a device with an internet connection, a pen and paper to make notes, and maybe some friends or family to play with!

This immersive, storytelling experience lasts around an hour. You’ll interact with characters and solve head-scratching challenges in a thrilling historical adventure that takes you all the way back to the time of the Pharaohs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cretaceous Rails
Description:
Travel back in time to the Cretaceous era, build a rail network into the jungle, take time-traveling tourists on safari to see their favorite dinosaurs in the wild, and build a resort full of attractions to customize your strategy with exciting abilities. This quick-playing mid-weight Euro for 1-4 players features an innovative dual-action worker placement system, route building, tableau building, and resource management. Utilize the resources of the Cretaceous jungle to build the optimal combination of attractions for abilities and scoring.

—description from the publisher

Name: はないちもんめ (Hana Ichi Monme)
Description:
ã¯ãªã„ã¡ã‚‚ã‚“ã‚ (Hana Ichi Monme) is a bluffing card game from Japan for 2 or 3 players. The title means something like 'flower position'.

Each player has a set of seven cards in their own colour. Some cards are Warabe (children) and some are Ayakashi (weird). If a player can give away all their weird cards by the end, they win. Otherwise, points are calculated.

Each card has a shadow half, and a bright half, on both sides of the card. So a player can look at another player's hand and see which cards are the bright side up and shadow side up. Players arrange their own hands at the start of the game, and cannot change this later.

At the start of the game, all the cards in the player's hand are shadow side up.

Players take turns to offer a card to another player, by drawing the card up a little in their hand. The player offered either takes it or declines it, but either way the card is now turned shadow side down, and cannot be offered away. If the card was taken, the player can place it anywhere they like in their hand. If declined, it stays in the same position as before and cannot be moved.

Once every hand is shadow side down, the game ends. If a player has disposed of all their own Ayakashi cards, they win. Collecting Ayakashi cards from other players does not matter.

Otherwise, players score points. +1 pt for Warabe cards, -1 or -2pts for Ayakashi cards. But if a Ayakashi cards is flanked by Warabe cards, it is worth zero. Then, the most points wins.

The rules allow for a 4 player game using two packs. In this case, it is played as a doubles game, with partners discussing their moves.
user summary

Name: Of Light and Darkness
Description:
The battle between good and evil is ceaseless. It stretches as far back as the beginning of time, and continues to rage in present day. This is where you come in. It's time to pick a side. Will you be a hero, and command the forces of light? Or, are you a villain, determined to lead those who dwell in darkness? The choice is yours.

Of Light and Darkness is a 2-player game in which you get to play as either good (heroes) or evil (villains). Some cards have special abilities. Others don't. Your goal is simply to have the most of your cards on the table, and connected by sharing a side, when all cards have been used.

Name: Falling Down
Description: Falling Down is an autumn season-themed game, but it also involves the element of "gravity." During play, you endeavour to make matches between multiples of cards that contain the same imagery, to collect as many as possible. However, the animals can only be collected when they fall out of the bottom of the grid of cards on the playing surface. It's a game of matching, strategy, and turn taking.

Name: Escaping Mars
Description: In Escaping Mars, you role play as one of the last remaining citizens of Colony 7, a settlement on a post-terraformed Red Planet (which has been overrun by a ruthless gang known as The Brotherhood of Broken Skulls), in the year 3254. During play, your goal is to get past the baddies, find the "battery unit," power up the last working drone transport, fend off other citizens who have the same idea, and get out while you still can.

Name: Zòku
Description: In Zòku, you control one of four groups of characters (Preps, Jocks, Nerds, or Misfits), as you try to be the first to assemble a connected group of your peers on the school playground, and push the other cliques out. Each character card has a number that represents its "personality strength" that, during play, determines whether or not it can be used to push other characters around on the playing surface. It's a fun, quirky, adorably schoolyard-themed card game with 68 original characters!

Name: Uno: Schitt's Creek
Description:
It's the UNO matching card game everyone knows but featuring favorite characters from Schitt's Creek. Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching color, number and symbol, but every card has either a 'Love' or 'Money' icon on it. When someone plays a special 'Where Everyone Fits In' card, they call out either 'love' or 'money.' Players then reveal their hands and may have to draw cards if they don't have enough of the chosen icon. And just like always, when a player is down to one card, they must shout, 'UNO!' Makes a great gift for card game lovers and Schitt's Creek fans ages 7 years and older. Colors and decorations may vary.

The classic UNO card game builds fun on game night with themes inspired by Schitt's Creek.
Each game features a deck decorated with character graphics from beloved show!
As in classic UNO game, players match colors, numbers and symbols to the card on top of the discard pile!
A special 'Where Everyone Fits In' rule may force some player to draw cards.
Makes a great gift for kid, teen, adult and family game nights with 2 to 10 players ages 7 years and older!
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Escape Quest: Pour une Poignée de Néodollars
Description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ... Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

Los Angeles, 2062. Nuclear war and economic disaster have left all power in the hands of massive corporations  You are just a young, self-taught hacker making ends meet in the sprawl, until one night you receive a cryptic message from a mysterious sender: “Join us”. You are then suddenly swept into a race for your own survival, and perhaps that of all the other users on the network ! Sides become blurry; which lines will you cross ? Is the ultimate hacking code worth your life, or just a few neodollars more?

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape Quest: Au delà du Virtuel
Description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ...

Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

Los Angeles, 2101. ASTRAL, the largest VR online gaming platform in the world is run by Demosthenes, a true AI, and something went terribly wrong. Millions of users suddenly dropped into a virtual coma, and nobody knows why. It falls on you to understand what happened and save the countless lives at stake. Confront the virtual worlds designed by the AI, for their many deadly challenges hold the key to solving this not-so-virtual mystery !

Name: Hnefatafl: The Viking Tales
Description:
Immerse yourself in the world of new boardgame Hnefetafl: The Viking Tales and lead your troops to victory in a strategic game for up to four players! Play as a various characters from the Viking history and mythology while competing with your friends in various scenarios.

The game of Hnefatafl, often translated as "Kings' Table" began its life in Scandinavia over 1600 years ago. In the traditional version, one player is a king with troops who are caught in an ambush by the forces of the second player.

Hnefetafl: The Viking Tales has been expanded to include a 4-player version, while preserving simple rules that guarantee long hours of fun with countless gameplay possibilities. Each game includes a variety of scenarios with multiple goals to achieve. The stories are presented as Sagas in which you will play as famous Vikings and Gods from Scandinavian mythology.

Name: Ahau: Eclipse
Description:
The first official expansion of Ahau: Rulers of Yucatáns adds 14 Eclipse cards, 6 additional role cards, 5 building tiles and 10 special pyramid tiles, to enhance your Ahau experience. The Eclipse event cards provide more opportunities and challenges for scoring, resource conversion, summoning, and strategic gameplay in each round.

Eclipse introduces us to the history-shaping, cataclysmic and mythical events of the Classic Period.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lizards and Lies
Description:
Do you want to sow conspiracy or stop it in its tracks? Lizards and Lies is a 2v2 (or 1v1) battler that lets you play with the push and pull of conspiracy theory moving through social media. Play as one of four characters and use unique abilities and cards to influence the network. Platform Moderators and Educators face off against Edgelords and Conspiracy theorists in this asymmetrical board brawler. Will you convince the world that lizards are taking over, or that birds are surveilling society? Or will you shut down these lies?

Lizards and Lies is designed as a serious game meant to reflect the movement of disinformed content (like conspiracy) through social media.

—description from the publisher

Name: Le Mura di Alesia
Description:
52 BC. The Gallic tribes led by Vercingetorix were defeated by the army of Gaius Julius Caesar near Dijon and retreat to the city of Alesia, convinced to find in this fortress a safe position and the time necessary to regroup the troops and recover morale.

Julius Caesar, sensing the intentions of the enemy, also takes advantage of the particular isolated position of the city, planning one of the most ingenious sieges in history. He built two rings of fortifications, one external and one internal, to defend himself at the same time from attacks from the city and from the tribes who came to the aid of the besieged. The walls were fortified with towers, ditches and traps and sanctioned the victory of the Romans over the Gauls.

In The Walls of Alesia each of the two players takes the role of a Roman Legatus, commissioned by Caesar to supervise the construction of one of the two walls. Each one will have to take care of creating the most effective fortifications, hiring the necessary workers and deciding for each stretch whether to obtain immediate advantages from the palisades or to erect towers that will guarantee future advantages.

There will be a high competition in this constructors' challenge, but during the match there will also be two coordinated assaults by the Gauls, in which the Legates will have to cooperate to limit the damage. At the end of the second assault, it will be verified who has obtained the most prestige in the eyes of Julius Caesar.

—description from the publisher

Name: TOKKA Race
Description:
TOKKA Race is a dexterity game where wooden pieces are used to construct the boundaries of a race track. The players use finger-flicks to send small pucks around the track, a la Carrom.
During the race players can unlock one-use special abilities, e.g. when another puck is moved outside the game boundaries, which give them an extra move or allows them to try to flick another player outside of the game boundaries.
The race lasts five rounds and whoever crosses the finish line first is the winner.

Name: DICE PARK: Dungeons of Doom
Description:
DICE PARK: Dungeons of Doom is a roll&write for 1 to 100 players ages 8 and up.

During 30-45 minutes games, players will have to use their dice to create the most frightening dungeon.

Roll your dice (5 in total) and use them to create a path in your Dungeon, place creatures and score the most points to become THE Dungeon Master!

—description from the publisher

Name: ExoTerra
Description:
Welcome to the universe of ExoTerra, a sandbox strategy game with tactical planning, deep customization, and enemies who are complex and highly challenging.

ExoTerra is played cooperatively by 1 to 4 players over the course of many sorties in a campaign. Each Player takes on the role of a Pilot in charge of requisitioning equipment, personnel, supplies, and, most importantly, Jackets – massive humanoid weapon systems, to be customized and fielded in battle.

Leveraging a new system of enemy generation, battles should always feel different, even if facing the same enemies.  This is accomplished through several factors of enemy customization that force players to assess each situation individually.  You can rely on your experience from past battles, but must be able to change your strategy on the fly based on the variables of the mission.

You can learn more about ExoTerra on our website - Wyldegames.com

—description from the designer

Name: Game of Gnomes
Description:
Be the first to grab the correct gnome!

A round begins by one player rolling the three dice. Each die represents either a shirt colour, a garden tool or a stylish accessory. Using the provided grabbers, players try and be the first to grab the gnome that matches all three categories rolled.

The first player to grab the correct matching gnome wins the round. Be the first player to grab 5 gnomes and win the game!

Name: Sherlock Holmes: Der Tod des Hutmachers
Description:
Escape Card Game for up to 4 players

London, 1891.
The highly respected hatter Mr. Kenworthy is found dead. His store shows no signs of burglary, his body no sign of violence. What happened and who is behind the crime?

In this exciting Escape Room game you slip into the role of master detective Sherlock Holmes to solve the case of the dead hatter. Only if you show a sharp mind, ingenuity and a gift for deduction, you can find the murderer and solve the ominous background of this crime.

—description from the publisher (translated)

London, 1891.
Der hoch angesehene Hutmacher Mr. Kenworthy wird tot aufgefunden. Sein Laden zeigt keine Einbruchsspuren, seine Leiche keinerlei Gewalteinwirkung. Was ist passiert und wer steckt hinter der Tat?

In diesem spannenden Escape-Room-Spiel schlüpft ihr in die Rolle von Meisterdetektiv Sherlock Holmes, um den Fall des toten Hutmachers zu lösen. Nur wenn ihr einen scharfen Verstand, Einfallsreichtum und Kombinationsgabe beweist, könnt ihr den Mörder Stellen und die ominösen Hintergründe dieses Verbrechens aufklären.

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Into The Echoside: The Shaggy Show
Description:
A single promotional card only available from the Dark Carnival Games Con in 2018.

From the card's announcement on Facebook: "IT’S SHAGGGGYYY TIMMMMEEE! World Premiere: We present to you: THE SHAGGY SHOW promo card!!! DCG Con, May 11-13th, in Denver, is the ONLY place you can cop the Oracle of the Three Rings expansion for Into the Echoside, featuring the exclusive Shaggy Show Promo Card! You’ll get this exclusive card FREE with your purchase of Oracle…ONLY at the Con. Only at the DCG Con. For Juggalos, By Juggalos!"

Name: Into The Echoside: Promo Card Set
Description:
A set of three promotional cards, one from each faction, for Into The Echoside. They were all included in a single pack available for those who preordered Into The Echoside: Oracle of the Three Rings.

The three cards were Inner City Posse, Wizard of the Hood, and Blahzay Rose.

Name: Corruptia: Segunda Vuelta
Description:
From the designers of Corruptia, came a new game for 2 players!

Welcome to Corruptia: Second Round, an asymmetrical card game where a business man and a candidate try to obtain the major quantity of personal benefits during the second round of the presidential elections.

As the benefactor, you will try to buy the presidential candidate offering different agendas for your economical convenience in exchange to finance their campaign.

As the candidate, you will try to gain resources for your campaign taken economic agendas that doesn´t affect you too much on your personal reputation with your voters.

After 8 turns of negotiations, the player who obtain the major benefits will win the game.

Any resemblance with reality is only coincidence...

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape Game Verschollen im Bermuda Dreieck
Description:
You are stranded on a remote island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle where strange experiments seem to be taking place... Solve the mysteries you come across! Find out what's going on on the island! And fight the dangerous secret organisation ARES to escape from there!

Contents: - Adventure cards to explore the island and solve the puzzles! - Door lock code cards to gain access anywhere! - Encrypted records to uncover the secrets of the island!

Ihr seid auf einer abgelegenen Insel mitten im Bermuda-Dreieck gestrandet, auf der offenbar seltsame Experimente stattfinden … Löst die Rätsel, auf die ihr stoßt! Findet heraus, was auf der Insel vor sich geht! Und kämpft gegen die gefährliche Geheimorganisation ARES, um von dort zu entkommen!

Inhalt: - Abenteuer-Karten zum Erkunden der Insel und zum Lösen der Rätsel! - Türschloss-Code-Karten, die euch überall Zugang verschaffen! - Verschlüsselte Aufzeichnungen, mit denen ihr die Geheimnisse der Insel aufdeckt!

Name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Altered Fates
Description:
Lady Helena, the woman who hired you, is abducted through a polychromatic portal before your eyes! With the portal closing and only moments to act, you must decide who will follow into the unknown. Will you be able to work together even while torn apart?

Altered Fates challenges investigators like never before by dividing the team across two maps that are in play simultaneously. The first is a proper 1920s mansion, like those you have come across in previous investigations. The second, however, is the future of this home— now an abandoned, boarded-up building. Each map presents its own series of challenges, with the investigators in the present directly affecting the investigation of their companions in the future: an item tucked beneath a loose floorboard may be found later in the same hiding place, or a rescued captive may be able to return to the mansion in the future.

Name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – What Lies Within
Description:
A murder in Southside leaves a home abandoned–except for the strange noises coming from the cellar…

What Lies Within is a scenario for 1-5 investigators in which a murder is only the beginning of the inexplicable occurrences in one Arkham mansion. Investigators will explore a murder scene, fend off terrible creatures, encounter strange phenomena, and investigate the noises coming from the cellar of the supposedly empty house. They must discover why the victim was murdered–and what he did with his life before it was so violently ended–in order to leave the mansion alive.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Dark Reflections
Description:
An isolated country estate’s secrets come to light when a woman inexplicably vanishes from its rooms!

Dark Reflections is a scenario for 1-5 investigators in which the disappearance of Ada Miller ignites a series of events that warps the nature of reality. Investigators will travel to a crumbling country manor in search of Ada’s ultimate fate. Inside, they must decipher what Ada left behind and withstand a variety of strange and frightening events as the walls separating their reality from another begin to collapse.

—description from the publisher

Name: Who Wants To Be A Billionaire
Description:
Explore the world of tech from your tabletop! Build a 1-billion-dollar startup (a unicorn), and along the way, discover 70+ modern strategies and 15+ career fields in STEM and Liberal Arts, recognizing how the greatest technology companies have become successful!

Brief overview of how the game is played:

To start, players roll two eight-sided dice to go around the board and hire people, then acquire technologies. After that, players are eligible to launch products and features upon which they get users, which increases the valuation of their start-up. The players pick action cards along the way that gives them a glimpse into the workings of Artificial Intelligence, Digital Marketing, Cloud Computing and Cybersecurity, in a fun way while continuing to build their startup.

The first player whose startup becomes a unicorn, by reaching a $1 billion valuation, wins. Other players race on for the next spot.

Name: Hey! That's Not'chyo Nacho!
Description:
In Not'chyo Nacho! you are hungry and eager to gobble up your NACHOS! Only there's a problem - the nacho toppings are all mixed up and you want your nachos your way!

You'll have to trade chips with other players (eaters) to match all the toppings on your nachos.

Be careful not to miss one in your haste that is NOT'CHYO NACHO! because you must lay down all 7 of your matching NACHOS first, to win!

Players play simultaneously, in a frenzied atmosphere as they all seek to get a handful of matching NACHOS.

You'll need to get loud and even a little pushy if you've any hope of getting all your NACHOS first!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Castles of Burgundy: Special Edition
Description:
Castles of Burgundy is a legendary Board Game design created by Stefan Feld. In this 1-4 players tabletop experience, you will take on the role of an aristocrat controlling a small princedom. Trying to build a settlement with powerful castles, practice trades, exploit silver mines, and use the knowledge of travelers.
Now, this timeless game is coming back with an extremely polished, high-end special edition resulting from a collaboration between Ravensburger and Awaken Realms.

In this special edition, you can expect a complete re-design of art and layout to ensure that every piece will have great art and enhance in-game usability. Only the best materials (cardboard, cart paper, box, insert, etc.) will be used to provide endurance, and a premium feel. Many extra components will bring the gaming experience to the next level, such as double-layered player boards, special bags for hexes, 30% bigger tiles, or metal coins.

The Castles of Burgundy is set in the Burgundy region of High Medieval France. Each player takes on the role of an aristocrat, originally controlling a small princedom. While playing, they aim to build settlements and powerful castles, practice trade along the river, exploit silver mines, and use the knowledge of travelers.

The game is about players taking settlement tiles from the game board and placing them into their princedom, which is represented by a Duchy board that is placed in the Player board.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Black Hole
Description:
An abstract game of losing meteors, the aptly if generically named game of Black Hole revolves around setting your asteroids on paths that will have them ricochet off other asteroids, straight into the pocket in the center.

Every turn you get to move one of your pieces in a straight line orthagonically - like a giant space rook. If they strike another  of your pieces, that piece gets hurled to either side in a straight line. Pieces that cross the black hole in the center get removed from play - first to remove four pieces in this way wins the game.

Name: Le Corbeau et le Renard
Description:
The game theme refers to a tale by La Fontaine: The craw and the fox.
One player gets the fox, the other one the craws placing 5 of his 10 craws on the tree spaces on the first line of the board. The fox player cannot see if a craw has a cheese in its mouth or not. In his turn, the craw player has 5 action points. He may use for each craw at most 1 point. There are 3 possible actions: entering new craws at the base line, advance a craw to a tree of the next line, eating a cheese for as many victory points as the number of the line. This craw is out of the game now. 
The fox player may move his fox one space within the fox net. All these spaces are connected with 1 to 4 trees. He may ask a craw on a connected tree to sing. If the craw has a cheese, it is out of the game, if not, it will continue. After all craws are out of the game, the roles change. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Iron Helm: Iron Chest
Description:
Iron Chest is the largest, and the final, expansion for Iron Helm and it packs a punch in terms of content. You will need the base game of Iron Helm to use this expansion. So what is in the box?

The Spire of Zogar This is the final Adventure Pack for Iron Helm and pits you against the evil tyrant Zogar himself! It consists of 18 cards including new loot, plot, and enemy cards, and a new boss, Zogar himself!

The Lonely Troll Inn This 18 card pack unlocks the ability to hire henchmen before you set off on an adventure. Simply pay some gold and they will tag along. Each one will provide different perks and each will have unique ways that their morale will drop. If they lose all their morale, they will leave, unless you pay them some more money. The provided 12mm die is used to track your henchmen's morale. This pack also includes a bunch of new trappings to equip your hero with!

Beasts & Burdens This 18 card pack introduces Afflictions! These nasty cards are gained in a number of ways and will cause the mechanics for play to change. Maybe you will suffer from gluttony and need to eat twice as much in between dungeon levels, or perhaps, you become plagued and start gaining poison at an alarming rate! This pack also includes a bunch of unique, and stronger, enemies to deal with and three mini-bosses that are actually plot cards!

Realms & Relics So you want more powerful items in Iron Helm? Now you get them! Artifacts are powerful relics that you can gain by spending blessing tokens when you are asked to draw a loot card. Spend the required blessing tokens and draw an artifact card instead! That is only half of this pack. It also introduces environment cards. These are drawn at the beginning of each dungeon level and they change the mechanics for that level. Maybe you are on the Shadow level and you are ambushed whenever an ambush card is drawn, even if it is the first card drawn! Or maybe you are in the Parched and all fire creatures are stronger.

Random Encounters This includes four double-sided jumbo map cards to track what level of the dungeon you are on. Also included are three minis (Male Ranger, Female Warrior, and Male Wizard) to use to track your position. Random Encounters adds a new mechanic where your hero encounters something in between each level of the dungeon. Symbols on the map cards indicate what the player will run into. Maybe Bolda trap, or some mushrooms, or a nasty foe lurking in the shadows...

Card Dividers This is not the sexiest addition, but these new dividers will keep your copy of Iron Helm nice and organized and sometimes order is sexy...

Name: Flying Colors
Description:
An abstract game of spreading coloured chips around, Flying Colors is a game for 2 or 3 people.

Piles of chips get moved around the hexagonal grid, with each player trying to make bits of three adjacent discs of the same colour for points.

Name: How to Lose a Guy in One DM
Description: Finally, a game that makes fun of all the cringiest, weirdest, most awful behavior soooo many of us have dealt with in online dating. It's simple and hilarious: a Judge reads aloud the dude's profile and then deals out 3 of his texts sliding into your DMs later and later at night getting angrier or more desperate or cringier.... and the other players "Clapback with their funniest response. Players can choose whether to share a creative defense of why their response is BEST or just read aloud their best reply in the sassiest voice possible!

Name: Madera contra Acero: La Conquista de Canarias
Description:
Masqueoca NAC wargames in its project to promote games with a national theme has been kind enough to include in its programme one with a hitherto unpublished and original theme, and as a Canarian designer it is a great satisfaction for me to present it.  Wood against Steel, The Conquest of the Canary Islands. Already the title gives us a small clue of the inequality in weaponry on the sides involved in this war.  The wooden and stone weapons of the Guanches against the iron and steel of the conquerors of the Crown of Castile. But make no mistake, even though it was a very unequal struggle, the conquest of the whole archipelago lasted no less than 94 years, practically a whole century of fighting, precisely in the 15th century, which is enough to show that it was not a military stroll. By way of comparison, the conquest of America took about 40 years. It should be noted that the clash between the indigenous Canary Islanders and the Castilian troops was brutal. 
This war involved the Canary aborigines, called Guanches, and the conquistadors, on the one hand sent by the Crown of Castile and on the other sent by the Crown of Portugal. Both kingdoms coveted control of these islands, which were so strategic in their overseas territorial expansion.

It is a wargame for two players, where the Castilians slowly but continuously land on each of the 7 islands through the arrival of ships loaded with conquerors and the Guanches try by all means to stop and expel the newcomers to their earthly paradise. The game is played by secret and simultaneous orders and with the help of two decks of event cards, so the turns are a lot of fun and with variable strategy adapted to the moment.
The battles are resolved on a Battle mat with special rules for mountain regions. There are also naval battles. The Castilian player wins if he has conquered the 7 Canary Islands in the last turn.

—description from the designer

Masqueoca NAC wargames en su proyecto de fomento de juegos con temática nacional ha tenido a bien incluir en su programa uno con temática hasta ahora inédita y original, y que como diseñador canario es una gran satisfacción para mi presentar.  Madera contra Acero, La Conquista de Canarias. Ya el titulo nos da una pequeña pista de la desigualdad en armamento en los bandos implicados en esta guerra.  Las armas de madera y piedra de los guanches contra el hierro y acero de los conquistadores de la Corona de Castilla. Pero que no llame a engaño, aun siendo una lucha muy desigual, la conquista de todo el archipiélago duró nada menos que 94 años, prácticamente todo un siglo de combates, precisamente el siglo XV,  ello es un indicador suficiente para entender que aquello no fue un paseo militar. Como comparación la conquista de America duró unos 40 años. Se hace necesario destacar que el choque entre los indígenas canarios y las tropas castellanas fue brutal. 
Esta guerra en la que intervinieron los aborígenes canarios, llamados guanches, y los conquistadores , por un lado enviados por la Corona de Castilla y por otro enviados por la Corona de Portugal. Ya que ambos reinos codiciaban el control de estas islas tan estratégicas en su expansión territorial de ultramar.
Es un wargame para dos jugadores, donde el castellano mediante la llegada lenta pero continua de barcos cargados de conquistadores va desembarcando en cada una de las 7 islas y los guanches intentan por todos los medios frenar y expulsar a los recién llegados a su paraíso terrenal. Se juega mediante ordenes secretas y simultaneas y con la ayuda de dos mazos de cartas de eventos , con lo cual los turnos son muy divertidos y con estrategia variable adaptada al momento. Las batallas se resuelven en un mapa de batalla anexo con reglas especiales para las regiones montañosas. También hay batallas navales.
El jugador castellano ganará si en el ultimo turno ha conquistado las 7 islas canarias.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Steps
Description:
STEPS GAMES are fun and exciting games in which players build structures by throwing wooden plates, called Stepses, onto a platform. The first player to get rid of all their Stepses is the winner!

Sound easy? It's not!
One does not simply put Steps on the structure.

You should throw it in a way, so that it touches the opponent's Steps when landing.

You need a strategy that works for you but against your opponents, one that you will constantly need to adjust during the game.

The winner must apply physics, engineering, logic, strategy, and a little bit of luck. All of which are useless without a well-aimed throw.

It is an utterly unpredictable game where you won’t know if your next throw will work until you try it.

You and your friends won't be bored while playing the game!

The basic principle of the game is to keep the structure upright on your turn but unstable enough that it collapses on an opponent’s turn.

There are six types of Stepses (for example rectangular) with different weights, sizes, and colors. The variations in size and weight mean that each type of Steps behaves differently when played.

Want to add a personal touch to the game?

You can have your name, motto, company name, or logo engraved on the Steps!

For a spectacular victory, take your Personal Steps and throw it with a flip so that it lands with your name up

This is how a Stepsman wins the game!

Play for any Company: Have fun with friends & colleagues, play with your family. It is interesting for children too, you can even play Solo!
If you play alone, you need to throw all the Stepses from the set on the playing board so that not a single Steps falls out of it.

If at least one falls out, improve your skills and start again!

Name: Usurper Battle System: Titans of Tartarus
Description:
From the triangular game pieces to the diamond shaped game board you'll have trouble finding anything like what the Usurper Battle System has to offer. You'll have an even harder time putting this game down once you've learned the rules.

In this campaign (Titans of Tartarus) You'll choose one of the four banished Olympian Gods.  You'll build a team of specialized Mortal units and together you'll use them to unleash a Titan's power and escape the prison you've been banished to.

This campaign comes with the Core Rule Set, a game board (Battleboard), 2 full sets of Battle Tokens including 8 Gods, 12 Mortals and 2 Titans.

—description from the designer

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Order Affiliation Pack
Description:
The minions of Thanos are unleashed in Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Order Affiliation Pack, which combines the characters previously found in the Corvus Glaive & Proxima Midnight and Black Dwarf & Ebony Maw expansion packs.

In addition to miniatures of each of these characters, this pack also includes stat cards featuring updated graphic design for all four as well as all of the Team Tactic cards found in the original packs. Finally, players will also find copies of the Space, Time, Mind, and Reality Infinity Gems that help them unlock the full potential of their Black Order characters.

—description from the publisher

Name: CRIMELAND: Akte Falkenstein
Description:
CRIME ESCAPE EXPERIENCE FOR HOME - Ideal for a convivial game night with friends and family
CAPTIVATING STORY - More than 25 realistic investigation documents and multimedia content take you into the world of real detectives for 2-3 hours of fun
FUN IN TEAM - For adults and children from 14 years - 1 to 6 people
GIVE AWAY - Perfect gift for all board game nerds, escape room enthusiasts and fans of tricky puzzles
SUSTAINABLE - Crimeland relies on sustainable materials and is a plastic-free & climate-neutral product with resource-saving packaging

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Swan & Supergiant
Description:
Thanos' Black Order gains two powerful new members with Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Swan & Supergiant.

A princess of an alternate Earth, Black Swan uses her ability to project eyebeams of energy and superhuman physique to support the Mad Titan's conquest of worlds. Joining her is Supergiant, an omnipath and telepathic parasite. Her powers allow her to read the minds of and control anyone she encounters, which she uses to steal and devour the intellects of her hapless prey. Beyond their own powers, Black Swan and Supergiant also bring three Team Tactic cards that help them synergize with other members of the Black Order, making them an even more formidable fighting force.

—description from the publisher

Name: Akte 001: Kunstfehler
Description:
A MULTIMEDIA HUNT WITH REAL INDICATIONS - Detected with real letters, credit cards, photos, documents, and digitally on the Internet - the perpetrator has left traces everywhere. Combine together and collect evidence. Everything is allowed in this detective game - just like in real police work! Check your solutions on the game website and the inspector will tell you if you're right.

THE PERFECT GAME NIGHT because there are no complicated rules, you can start right away. It doesn't matter whether you're a puzzle game beginner or a pro: Thanks to the selectable difficulty in the game app, every team gets their money's worth. Whether as a gift, for a murder mystery evening, a murderous dinner party or just because - this Cold Case crime scene game sweeps everyone away.

CAPTIVATING STORY - Two bodies are found at an art gala. How did the botox doctor and the art hunter die? What was a windy car mogul and an ambitious influencer doing at the crime scene? Find the killer, determine the motives and solve the Murder Mystery!
?

NOW YOU ARE THE COMMISSIONER - Become a homicide detective. Places the perpetrators in an exciting jungle of intrigues, clues and spicy details. But be careful: the perpetrator is still one step ahead of you! The game does not have to be destroyed and can therefore be played more often.
? If you are not 100% satisfied with the escape room game, we find a solution - just write to us! What are you waiting for? Add Crime Cases detective game to cart now!

Name: Pixelate
Description:
Unleash your unlimited imagination with limited blocks in Pixelate, the bad pixel art game from Ridley's Games! Make an array of weird and wonderful creations with colorful wooden pixel blocks for other players to guess. The better you do, the less blocks you have to work with, until you're hilariously trying to make a lightbulb with only 4 pixels!

Contains:
Instructions
84 picture cards
12 clue cards
4 score cards
60 wooden pixels
1 art board.

Name: Abszolút képtelen sztorik
Description:
Abszolút képtelen sztorik is the third game in the word-and story-related Abszolút series published by book and game publisher Pagony.

In the game box you'll find 30 two-sided story cards (with 9 elements of a story, numbered), 9 number cards, cards to vote for each player, a notebook and a story book.

Draw one of the number cards. Everyone looks at their story card and writes the first (in later rounds, next) sentence for the story. They read it aloud and players vote with cards (0 to 3 points) for the best sentence (including their own). The sentence that gets the highest score will be written in the storybook. The player who wrote this sentence scores 3 points, everyone else scores as many points as the number they assigned to the winning player.

Keep writing the story this way, eventually using all the number cards. (For a shorter game, only certain numbers are used.) The player with the most points total wins, but of course it's the story that you've written together that matters.

Name: Adventure Realms: The Last Fantasy
Description:
In this expansion, you aren't just racing through the dungeon anymore, you are also dealing with corruption. If you aren't participating in the dungeon, you are seen to the rest of the world as corrupt. Now, you'll be losing resources between turns if you are corrupted, however, you'll gain benefits for being a certain amount of corrupt. Who knew being bad can be so good?

You'll also have Leader cards to choose from in the beginning of the game. These will give the players a special ability as well as a player specified quest they can complete. This gives players more of a focus at the start of the game.

There are also a ton of new Adventure and Hero cards that may activate when you reach a certain amount of corruption.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Feed the Kraken: Bonus Character Cards
Description:
Part of the Funtails shipping donation rewards to battle the massively increased shipping costs.

4 bonus character cards. These 4 cards look just as stunning as the other character cards and their effects have been playtested thoroughly for potential use in a future expansion. You will receive a PDF File from which you can print the cards. Place them in a sleeve in front of an unused card and start exploring!
-description from publisher's website

These cards were available as print and play document on the Funtails online store for some time.

Name: Isla
Description: Careful planning and strategic decisions will be critical as you race against fellow explorers to explore this undiscovered island. Along the way, you will face tough decisions and threatening perils, each choice shaping your fate. What flora, fauna and fossils will you discover?
